comment:
She's such a sweet lady! She truly wants her students to succeed. There are 9 assignments in total including the final project (PR PLAN) and a few discussion posts. The workload was pretty light to me. I'm also very excited to have her again in a another course this fall. 

THE B-E-S-T !!
She is such a sweet professor who really wants to see you succeed. Is very knowledgable on the topic of public relations. Highly recommend!

Took this class online, very easy and she makes it very easy to understand the information. Discussions weekly but they are pretty easy and fun to do. 4 tests on D2L. I definitely recommend taking her. I had a great time taking this class

Dr. Howes is the best professor I have come across at KSU. I have never met a professor who is so caring, understanding and kind. Dr. Howes understands that life happens and she is more than willing to work with her students. She truly wants the best for all of her students and it SHOWS. I have taken 3 of her classes and would take more if I could.
Super nice- helped me out a lot with late work.

I personally take offense to anyone who rates Professor Howes lower than a 5. She is literally on of THE BEST professors I've had during my college career. She's approachable, kind and she doesn't over-complicate her coursework. You can tell that she loves PR and really wants you to get it too.  Thank you Dr. Howes. Your ROCK!

She is the best! I had her online, and she made everything super easy to follow. She also has a cute, quirky little personality, so I suggest taking her. The tests are straight from the lectures, so they're super easy!!

Professor Howes was a very understanding and attentive professor. She was always super helpful with emailing reminders of due dates, etc. and definitely wants to see you succeed. The textbook is very necessary for the tests and discussion posts!

This is a simple online course. Just 4 exams, 10 discussions and an optional paper. You will need the book, but only need to reference it occasionally for some of the discussions. Watch the lectures, copy the slides, complete the discussions and exams on time and you should get an A or B. Well-organized course, did not have to email her at all.

Dr. Howes is an AMAZING choice. I took her 8 week summer class and there were a lot of lectures, but that comes with any summer class. Her ppts are informative and prep you for tests. You'll refer to your textbook a few times throughout the course but not too much. She's super sweet and kind. Offered a few extra credit opps! Take her if you can!
Prof Howes was a delight! She made online work very easy to handle during the week. I enjoyed the case studies she selected for us to read and this was a very activating class for me.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She is extremely easy, and was a very nice easy class in between the hard ones. All we ever had to do were 4 tests and discussion posts that were easy to complete. My only pet peeve is that she said textbook isnt required, yet put questions specifically from the text in the exams. It was annoying.

Good teacher but this whole writing course in the major is selective to that teacher. Ive formatted work based on CNN articles , White House releases etc. And she marks things off so its confusing because if these reputable organizations do it this way why am I getting penalized. Ask beforehand how they want things presented.

Dr. Howes is one of my favorite professors of all time. She genuinely cares about her students and does her best to make every class both enjoyable and beneficial. She is a tough grader, but she gives great feedback and will work with you. Take her if you have the chance! She's the best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I took PR writing the first time it was offered online. I really enjoyed the format. She provides examples for each writing assignment. There is a large PR plan due at the end of the semester, but she gives a decent break from little assignments to complete it. She is a tough grader, but helps you learn from mistakes. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Discussion posts due every week, except when there's a test. The class helps outline how to deal with different PR cases, and it uses examples of companies from the past. Discussion posts aren't weighted much, but she has a policy for completing them.

Professor Howes is amazing! She has a lot of real world experience, and it shows. She teaches the material well and prepares students not just for exams, but for their careers. This class is fairly easy - weekly reading/discussion boards and four exams. She often posts things to make the class more interesting and helps students well. Take her!

I have never experienced a professor who cared as much as Professor Howes. Although she can be a bit of a push over, her genuine care and want for you to succeed is the very reason she is respected. I highly suggest taking her!

I took her summer online class and it was great! She's nice and she gives you all the information you need in order to ace her tests. You will need the textbook to answer the discussion posts and sometimes to prep for the tests. There were only tests and discussion posts to worry about. The only downside to her tests was that they were timed.

This was the second time taking her and taking her one last time in the fall! She is overall very experiences and has great feedback for things even outside of class. She really wants everyone to succeed but does a lot of reading off power points. She also incorporates at least one group project so beware. Pick a good group or you're stuck doing it

Professor Howes has a lot of real world experience, but she isn't super interesting to listen to. She mostly just reads off the PowerPoints, which is fine, but it just isn't that captivating and doesn't really get you thinking. She's a really nice lady and easy to talk to though.
Pretty straightforward online class. Do the discussion and read the book for the tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Such a wonderful professor, doe not expect much more than participation. Took for a hybrid class and had no problem keeping up with assignments. Everything was accessible but you definitely need your book to pass. Make sure you pick a good group because you are stuck with them all semester.

I have taken Ms. Howes four times for PR classes. She is well organized and makes things fair in her class. Her classes are very informative, but also not terribly difficult. Ms. Howes herself is very interesting because she has worked for Coke and usually brings in a guest speaker in important PR positions.

Professor Howes is wonderful! I took this class online and it wasn't bad whatsoever. 10 discussion posts, 3 tests and 2 papers. She posts pretty much exact study guides for the tests, and each paper only has to be 2 pages long. Grades fair and gives great feedback. You can definitely pass with the bare minimum. Take her if you get the chance!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She had real life examples for all of the topics and that really helped. She has actual experience in the field she's teaching and always made herself and her resources available to benefit the students on a personal level and I appreciated that. She gives A LOT of group work, but it really isn't that bad (and I hate group work.)

Dr. Howes is a great professor and advisor! PR Cases is super easy with her. Her tests are straightforward, and her essay assignments are short and simple. She really wants everyone to succeed. Definitely take her!

I took Cases with her for a maymester and it was a great class! 3 test, 1 paper, and 1 project. She made the class more discussion based which made it easier to understand the material. Cases are fun to read from the textbook!

Took this class as a hybrid. The lectures were a boring but bearable to sit through. She is a very sweet lady and I am taking her again next semester. The class is made up of mainly tests, but she gives you study guides for you each one and puts the lectures online. She gave you discussion opportunities but graded them easy and weren't worth much.

She is alright. If you are not the best test taker, then I would not recommend taking her. Class ONLY consist of 4 exams, 10 participation points and an optional paper. I feel like she could give more assignments to improve our grades by letter grade. I like projects more than test so taking her class was not something I enjoyed.
Great teacher -- experienced in the field. Have taken her for three classes at KSU

this is my 5th semester at KSU and this is the easiest class i've taken thus far. the modules are easy and clear-cut. most weeks, it's: read (which i stopped doing, so you probably don't have to bother either), lecture, power point (the same stuff from the lecture), discussion (really easy). 4 tests, all very easy. optional extra credit.
Loved this professor. Super easy if you study for the tests. The rest of the work comes from online discussions and a couple presentations.

I love this woman.  This is the second class I have taken with her.  I am taking campaigns with her in the Spring.  You won't have exams.  There is a PR plan that is worth 42% of your grade.  So be detailed.  She is very helpful and knowledgeable.  Treat your assignments like you are submitting them to your boss.

She is awesome. I wish I took her during the SPR/FALL versus the summer hybrid. I enjoyed her class.  I did better on the tests where she lectured.  Read the book and the PowerPoints and you will do well.I got an A. Don't be fooled by a test strictly being lecture because the next test will be over the book, the following could be a combination!

I had Professor Howes for both principles and cases. I took PR cases in a maymester and had a blast. The readings were fun and the class was very discussion-based. I enjoy Prof. Howes classes! She keeps them active and engaging. She always has a good story or two-- plus valuable real world experience.
LOVE mrs. howes. She has worked in the real world and will help you with anything you need!!
She's alright. Lectures are sometimes a little boring, but she posts them online. She has a good sense of humor, but is a STICKLER about laptops! :(

She was GREAT! Really sweet lady, and she always talks about Coca-Cola. Bring her a TAB drink and she'll love you forever. Really easy test, and she tries to make the class interesting. I took her twice and would take her again if I could!!!

I have no idea what these other people are talking about. I have take her twice, once for PR prin and once for PR cases. She is one of the best professors i have had. she shares a lot of real world stories and the classes are interesting. I got a B and an A bc i did well on the papers and her quizzes are over main ideas
Idk why the 2 bad reviews she has rl exp in p.r very clr on all assignments, quick  to answer emails and very friendly. Never seen her flustered or in a bad mood.
No Comments
